page.title: 09Education,schools,Welsh lang
page.content: The provision of a sound education for their children is a top priority for most parents. Cil-y-cwm primary school built in the last century has a teaching staff of one headmaster and one teacher. Of the 34 pupils, only five are from Welsh speaking homes. The decline in the number of Welsh speaking pupils has accelerated during the past 10 years. Older pupils are conveyed by bus to Llandovery Secondary School, 4 miles away.Educational activities organised by the W.I., Y.F.C. and Agricultural Training Board are much in demand. These include general knowledge quizzes, lectures nature walks and various demonstrations. The local piano teacher gives lessons to 40 pupils and there is a long waiting list.Towy Valley assoc conduct nature walks,talks on ecology etc.
